intro: Photinia beauverdiana var. notabilis, commonly known as the Crimson Glow Photinia, is a compact, evergreen shrub or small tree native to southern China. It features glossy, dark green leaves that turn vibrant red in the fall, adding ornamental value to gardens. The plant produces small, white flowers in spring, which are followed by red, fleshy berries that persist into winter. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its striking foliage and adaptability, it is a popular choice for landscaping in temperate climates.
